result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis A Watson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to:  count two. Release privileges for the Day Reporting Cener.

miscConds.notes: Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms, must provide a DNA sample; and cannot vote until  his civil rights are restored.

No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
Do not use or possess alcohol or illegally controlled substances.
Defense motion for expungement is denied.
AODA treatment or program.  Random screening.

timeConds.notes: Straight time.  No good time. STAYED for violations that is reported to the Court within 10 days of its occurence, to be served STRAIGHT TIME: to serve five (5) days for the first violation; 10 days for the second, and 30 days for the third.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $100.00 plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 5/1/16 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

records.addlTxt: Order For Cancellation of Huber/Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges Pursuant To Wisconsin Statutes Section 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03(4) received, signed, and filed with the court.

Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Konkol Br 44 for review. os
Bail Refund Packets
Bail Refund Check Packet
8/19/15 original bail refund notice/affidavit received did not match the signature on the bond form, new notice/affidavit mailed to surety/defendant on this date.  at
8/10/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety and surety/defendant.
Count one.
Count two.

Defendant Dennis A Watson in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 12 months at the House of Correction - consecutive to Count 2 - with release privileges for the Day Reporting Program..  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months - consecutive to Count 2. 

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) do not use or possess alcohol or illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) AODA, treatment or program; 6) seek & maintain employment; 7) cognitive intervention program; 8) parenting classes;  9)  SERVE 45 DAYS at the House of Correction - straight time - no good time - STAYED.   If the defendant has a violation that is reported to the Court within 10 days of its occurence the defendant is to serve for the 1st violtion 5 days at the House of Correction - straight time; for the 2nd violation 10 days at the House of Correction - straight time; for the 3rd violation 30 days at the House of Correction - straight time.

Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 60 days at the House of Correction with Huber for work and 12 days credit; pay a fine of $100 plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 5-1-16 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defense motion for expungement is denied.

Defendant Dennis A Watson in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Case passed to the afternoon.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Dennis A Watson in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  
Nicholas Cerwin for Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

*CASE HEARD FOR BY BRANCH 15 FOR BRANCH 03* 
*CASE HEARD WITHOUT CIRCUIT COURT FILE*  

Matter before the Court on walk-in basis to address JusticePoint violation; report received and filed.  Statements made by the state and defense.  Defendant paid for confirmation test on today.  The Court INCREASES BAIL by $2700.  The Court orders bail set at $6,000 CASH with same terms.   Parties previously selected a plea and sentencing date of 8-5-15 in Branch 03.  Parties advised that effective August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44, Room 316 of the Safety Building.  This Court will schedule this matter for plea hearing on 7-14-15 at 1:30 p.m. if no objection from Branch 3.  Case remains set for Plea and Sentencing on 8-05-15 at 8:30 a.m.
No reply from defendant or surety.  vp
